Date of Travel: JANUARY 2018
Airline: BRA Braathens Regional
Flight #: TF11
Aircraft: Avro RJ100
Livery: BRA Standard pastel rainbow      
Route: GOT-BMA
Tail number: SE-DSV
Miles: 235
Airborne time: 0h56m
Notes: Aircraft swap from RJ85
Cost to book: Around ¬£100, including bags and flexibility  - one way. 

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play!

I was in Gothenburg in 2016 and noticed a strange-looking airline with odd ‚Äúrainbow‚Äù style tail fins. I found out they were BRA Braathens Regional Airlines, a small domestic carrier operating mostly within Sweden from their hub at Bromma. 

So, naturally, I had to try them. At around ¬£100 one way this was by no means a cheap flight. These Gothenburg to Stockholm shuttles are meant for the business traveller and priced accordingly. The flight was full of people off to do a day‚Äôs business in Sweden‚Äôs capital. 

However, even given the price, I was still impressed by their service standard. This is an airline that knows who its customers are and the product is sensible and thoughtful. There‚Äôs even a breakfast served on the flight, a coffee and drinks service, a hot towel and a second drinks run. Very impressive on a flight of under an hour. 

Of course, the real highlight for me was an opportunity to fly one of these old RJ aircraft again. I can remember when they were the staple of BA Cityflyer flights from London City back when I was starting my flying addiction. They‚Äôre a fun aircraft to fly. A bit cramped, but their uniqueness ensures charm overrides pragmatism for me.
